body: there's a pulpy orange-y smell from juice factories....The edge of that other square cut from the rightBy the design of our own silent eyesIts consciousness of my white consciousness,Escapees from the cold work of living,As if your absence now concluded long ago.The weight of being born into exile is lifted.Billows the fog, cloaksNever does any motion, sound, or lightBefore those virile women!Dreaming time has reversed, I watch drowned snowI am sleeping, and dreaming, and wandering alongSilent patch of ultimate paint. You areSculpting each tree to fit your ghostly formshortcake, waffles, berries and creamI.
